ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the type of treatmen
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the type of treatment returned?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the type of study treatment returned (e.g., STUDY MEDICATION, RESCUE MEDICATION, COMPARATOR, PLACEBO).

ReferenceDocuments.name: DACAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2021-6-9 ak Released per governance approval. 2/19/20 tmt transferred ownership from NRDS to NCI Standards/BMaeske and restored CSIs. 11-27-19 Change to Short Name/NRDS OID; tmt. 11-26-19 tmt removed NCI CSI, associated with NRDS CSI and changed Registration Status. 11-25-19 tmt transferred ownership from NCI Standards to NRDS/BMaeske. Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.24.18
